revised_title: The Gas/Oxide Interface and the Oxidation of Metals: A Review of Growth Laws and Surface Reactions
tldr: This article discusses the importance of the gas/oxide interface in determining the growth laws of oxide films on metals. The authors explore two models of the saturated layer at the interface and their effects on the oxidation process. They also consider the role of surface reactions and the influence of the gas/oxide interface on the oxidation rate, providing insights into the behavior of various metal systems.
